What if one day they become more powerful than us and turn on us. Do you think we could regret having ever been of any service to them? So should we end NAFTA now because it may one day turn on us? Goodwill would be the result of helping people who need it. I wouldn't give money just to please people but I would please people anyways as a result of my actions. ResponseText: The reason it sounded like typical liberal speak is because you have this urge to help people using the government. Personally, I would like the Federal government to leave me alone and dont try to help anybody, except removing people from society that commit force or fraud (in the US only). Just because the government does try to help people does not mean I think it is right. You are right, in the long run the government can NOT help people. Specifics. I have seen the Israeli / Palestinian conflict non-stop for decades. Besides I have seen many wars occur in the area besides that. How can there be an imbalance of weapons in the Middle East? Here is how: One side is supplied with a large quantity of weapons. There was mutual assured destruction (MAD). Who is the bully? Who has the most weapons the Palestinians or the Israelis? Should we arm the underdog? No way! I dont think it is right giving a second grader a gun. If the second grader then shoots people we would and should be held responsible. Or should we go in and send troops? Hey, if you want to go over and help people or send them money go ahead. Viewing government actions for the past few decades, I would say they backfire more times than not. Even those that dont backfire seem to at a later time. Israel, Nigeria, Columbia, Viet Nam are not part of the US. You can help them personally, but IMHO our collective should not. Well, in a way I do agree with you. I think NAFTA was unnecessary. We could have just lowered Tariffs. What does concern me is the governing body that NAFTA requires, without oversight from our elected officials. I do agree NAFTA was bad there. BUT, we never needed to impose tariffs or taxes on goods. This initial government action should not have taken place. Correlating to what we are talking about : We should not have imposed taxes in the first place then we would not need NAFTA. We should never have given aid to Israel then according to OBL 9-11 probably would not have occurred (also we should not have stationed troops in Saudi Arabia - the other reason for 9-11) I did not say 9-11 would have happened if we did not stay out of foreign affairs. I did say 9-11 happened while we were doing what YOU advocate, ie giving money to foreign countries. So your actions did not prevent 9-11. My opinion: We should have never given money away in the first place. It might have been sold to us originally as good intentions but this road to hell is paved with good intentions (have you heard that quote?). Yes, I think there will be negatives to pulling our support for Israel. Our politicians would probably receive less money in the form of contributions. But on the up side: It would save the taxpayer money or at least keep the money here. We would be resented less throughout the Arab world. Israel is not part of the United States. It does not concern me anymore than any other country. If you want to help, go ahead, IMHO. You call me selfish because I do not favor forced charity. I contribute money besides what I pay in taxes. And yes I am selfish. No one will care for my kids like I do. You dont do you? I need to feed and shelter my kids, not the world. No, in fact much of the money we gave in aid to Africa went to purchasing weapons. Good point. They cant do a better job. This is what you dont understand. Maybe you are little young, I dont know. The government is not as good at the private sector and never will be.
